XKRT
XKRT is a low-level tasking runtime system.

  • xkrt
  • thread

67  /* thread states */
68  typedef enum thread_state_t
69  {
70  XKRT_THREAD_UNINITIALIZED = 0,
71  XKRT_THREAD_INITIALIZED = 1
72  } thread_state_t;
73 
74  // NOTES
75  //
76  // A binary tree of height 'n' has
77  // 'm' nodes with 2^(n-1) + 1 <= m <= 2^n - 1
78  // and 'k' leaves with 1 <= k <= 2^(n-1)
79  //
80  // <=>
81  //
82  // Given a binary tree with 'k' leaves, its height 'n' must verify
83  // 1 <= k <= 2^(n-1)
84  // <=> 0 <= log2(k) <= n-1
85  // <=> log2(k) + 1 <= n
86  // _ _
87  // So we need a tree of height 'n' = | log2(k) + 1 | to represent the 'k' threads
88 
89  /* type of nodes in the tree */
90  typedef enum team_node_type_t
91  {
92  XKRT_TEAM_NODE_TYPE_HYPERTHREAD = 0, // hyperthread
93  XKRT_TEAM_NODE_TYPE_CORE = 1, // core
94  XKRT_TEAM_NODE_TYPE_CACHE_L1 = 2, // shared cache, L2 or L3 typically
95  XKRT_TEAM_NODE_TYPE_CACHE_L2 = 3, // shared cache, L2 or L3 typically
96  XKRT_TEAM_NODE_TYPE_CACHE_L3 = 4, // shared cache, L2 or L3 typically
97  XKRT_TEAM_NODE_TYPE_NUMA = 5, // numa node
98  XKRT_TEAM_NODE_TYPE_SOCKET = 6, // full dram
99  XKRT_TEAM_NODE_TYPE_MACHINE = 7 // multi socket system
100  } team_node_type_t;
101

103  {
104  XKRT_TEAM_BINDING_MODE_COMPACT,
105  XKRT_TEAM_BINDING_MODE_SPREAD,
106  } team_binding_mode_t;

133  /* a thread */
134  typedef struct thread_t
135  {
136  public:

142  static void pop_tls(void);
143 
144  /* get the TLS */
145  static thread_t * get_tls(void);

148 
149  /* the thread team */
150  team_t * team;
151 
152  /* the place assigned to that thread */
153  thread_place_t place;
154 
155  /* the thread implicit task */
156  union {
157  task_t implicit_task;
158  char _implicit_task_buffer[task_compute_size(TASK_FLAG_DOMAIN, 0)];
159  };
160 
161  /* the current task */
162  task_t * current_task;
163 
164  # ifndef NDEBUG
165  std::vector<task_t *> tasks;
166  # endif /* NDEBUG */
167 
168  /* the thread state, use for synchronizing */
169  thread_state_t state;

172  pthread_t pthread;
173 
174  /* global thread tid */
175  int gtid;
176 
177  /* the tid in the team */
178  int tid;
179 
180  /* the device global id attached to that thread */
181  device_global_id_t device_global_id;
182 
183  /* the thread deque */
184  deque_t<task_t *, 4096> deque;
185  // NaiveQueue<task_t *> deque;
186 
187  /* tasks stack */
188  uint8_t * memory_stack_bottom;
189 
190  /* next free task pointer in the stack */
191  uint8_t * memory_stack_ptr;
192 
193  /* memory capacity */
194  size_t memory_stack_capacity;
195 
196  /* random number generator */
197  std::minstd_rand rng;
198 
199  /* lock and condition to sleep the mutex */
200  struct {
201  pthread_mutex_t lock;
202  pthread_cond_t cond;
203  volatile bool sleeping;
204  } sleep;
205 
206  struct {
207  /* next function index in the team functions */
208  uint32_t index;
209 
210  } parallel_for;
211 
212  /* previous TLS */
213  thread_t * prev;
214 
215  public:
216 
217  // thread_t(int tid) : thread_t(tid, 0, UNSPECIFIED_DEVICE_GLOBAL_ID) {}
218 
219  thread_t(
220  team_t * team,
221  int tid,
222  pthread_t pthread,
223  device_global_id_t device_global_id,
224  thread_place_t place
225  ) :
226  team(team),
227  place(place),
228  implicit_task(TASK_FORMAT_NULL, TASK_FLAG_DOMAIN),
229  state(XKRT_THREAD_INITIALIZED),
230  pthread(pthread),
231  gtid(gettid()),
232  tid(tid),
233  device_global_id(device_global_id),
234  deque(),
235  memory_stack_bottom(NULL),
236  memory_stack_capacity(THREAD_MAX_MEMORY),
237  rng(),
238  parallel_for{.index = 0},
239  prev(NULL)
240  {
241  // set current task
242  this->current_task = &this->implicit_task;
243 
244  // initialize sync primitives
245  pthread_mutex_init(&this->sleep.lock, 0);
246  pthread_cond_init (&this->sleep.cond, 0);
247  this->sleep.sleeping = false;
248 
249  // initialize implicit task dependency domain
250  task_dom_info_t * dom = TASK_DOM_INFO(&this->implicit_task);
251  new (dom) task_dom_info_t();
252  # ifndef NDEBUG
253  snprintf(this->implicit_task.label, sizeof(this->implicit_task.label), "implicit");
254  # endif
255 
256  // initialize memory allocator
257  while (1)
258  {
259  this->memory_stack_bottom = (uint8_t *) malloc(this->memory_stack_capacity);
260  if (this->memory_stack_bottom)
261  break ;
262 
263  this->memory_stack_capacity = (size_t) (this->memory_stack_capacity * 2 / 3);
264  if (this->memory_stack_capacity == 0)
265  this->memory_stack_bottom = NULL;
266  }
267  this->memory_stack_ptr = this->memory_stack_bottom;
268  assert(this->memory_stack_bottom);
269  }
270 
271  ~thread_t()
272  {
273  free(this->memory_stack_ptr);
274  }
275 
276  public:
277 
278 
279  /* pause the thread until 'test' returns false */
280  template<typename Func>
281  inline void
282  pause(Func && test)
283  {
284  // poll a few time before actually taking the lock
285  for (int i = 0 ; i < 16 ; ++i)
286  {
287  if (!test())
288  return ;
289  }
290 
291  pthread_mutex_lock(&this->sleep.lock);
292  {
293  while (test())
294  {
295  this->sleep.sleeping = true;
296  pthread_cond_wait(&this->sleep.cond, &this->sleep.lock);
297  }
298  }
299  pthread_mutex_unlock(&this->sleep.lock);
300  }
301 
302  inline void
303  wakeup(void)
304  {
305  pthread_mutex_lock(&this->sleep.lock);
306  {
307  if (this->sleep.sleeping)
308  {
309  this->sleep.sleeping = false;
310  // LOGGER_DEBUG("Waking up thread");
311  pthread_cond_signal(&this->sleep.cond);
312  }
313  }
314  pthread_mutex_unlock(&this->sleep.lock);
315  }
316 
317  void warmup(void);
318  task_t * allocate_task(const size_t size);
319  void deallocate_all_tasks(void);

322  // TASK HELPER //
324 
325  public:
326 
328  template <task_access_counter_t AC>
329  inline void
330  resolve(task_t * task, access_t * accesses)
331  {
332  return this->resolve(task, accesses, AC);
333  }
334 
335  inline void
336  resolve(task_t * task, access_t * accesses, task_access_counter_t AC)
337  {
338  (void) task;
339  assert(task->flags & TASK_FLAG_DEPENDENT);
340  assert(AC > 0);
341  assert(accesses);
342  assert(this->current_task);
343 
344  for (int i = 0 ; i < AC ; ++i)
345  task_dependency_resolve(this->current_task, accesses + i);
346  }
347 
348  template <typename... Args>
349  inline void
350  commit(
351  task_t * task,
352  void (*F)(Args..., task_t *),
353  Args... args
354  ) {
355  assert(this->current_task);
356  ++this->current_task->cc;
357  task->parent = this->current_task;
358  return __task_commit(task, F, args...);
359  }
360 
361  # ifndef NDEBUG
362  static void
363  dump_tasks(FILE * f, std::vector<task_t *> & tasks)
364  {
365  fprintf(f, "digraph G {\n");
366  for (task_t * & task : tasks)
367  {
368  if (task->flags & TASK_FLAG_DEPENDENT)
369  {
370  task_dep_info_t * dep = TASK_DEP_INFO(task);
371  access_t * accesses = TASK_ACCESSES(task);
372  for (int i = 0 ; i < dep->ac ; ++i)
373  {
374  access_t * pred = accesses + i;
375  fprintf(f, " \"%p\" [label=\"%s - ac %d\"] ;\n", pred, task->label, i);
376  for (access_t * succ : pred->successors)
377  fprintf(f, " \"%p\" -> \"%p\" ;\n", pred, succ);
378  }
379  }
380  }
381  fprintf(f, "}\n");
382  }
383 
384  void
385  dump_tasks(FILE * f)
386  {
387  thread_t::dump_tasks(f, this->tasks);
388  }
389  # endif /* NDEBUG */
390 
391  } thread_t;

397  /* a node in the topology graph */
398  typedef struct team_node_t
399  {
400  /* the node type */
401  team_node_type_t type;
402 
403  /* the thread owning that node */
404  thread_t * thread;
405 
406  } team_node_t;

416  struct team_binding_t
417  {
418  team_binding_t() :
419  mode(XKRT_TEAM_BINDING_MODE_COMPACT),
420  places(XKRT_TEAM_BINDING_PLACES_CORE),
421  places_list(NULL),
422  nplaces(0),
423  flags(XKRT_TEAM_BINDING_FLAG_NONE)
424  {}
425 
426  /* how to distribute threads among places */
427  team_binding_mode_t mode;
428 
429  /* the places, if XKRT_TEAM_BINDING_PLACES_EXPLICIT - then `thread_place_t` must be not null */
430  team_binding_places_t places;
431  thread_place_t * places_list;
432  int nplaces;
433 
434  /* additional flags */
435  team_binding_flag_t flags;
436 
437  };
438 
439  /* team description */
440  struct team_desc_t
441  {
442  team_desc_t() :
443  routine(NULL),
444  args(NULL),
445  nthreads(0),
446  binding()
447  {}
448 
449  // routine that will be executed by each thread
450  void * (*routine)(struct team_t * team, struct thread_t * thread);
451 
452  // user arguments
453  void * args;
454 
455  // number of threads to spawn
456  int nthreads;
457 
458  // type of the team
459  team_binding_t binding;
460 
461  // whether the master thread should be a member of the team or not
462  bool master_is_member;
463  };
464 
465  /* a team, currently is made of 1 thread max per device, bound onto its closest physical cpu */
466  struct team_t
467  {
468  // default constructor
469  team_t() : desc() {}
470 
471  // team description, to be filled by the user before forking it
472  team_desc_t desc;
473 
474  struct {
475 
477 
478  // threads
479  thread_t * threads;
480  int nthreads;
481 
482  // custom barrier for workstealing
483  struct {
484  std::atomic<int> n; /* for spawned threads to sync */
485  volatile int version;
486  pthread_cond_t cond; /* to sleep threads when synchronizing */
487  pthread_mutex_t mtx;
488  } barrier;
489 
490  // critical
491  struct {
492  pthread_mutex_t mtx;
493  } critical;
494 
496 
497  // if the routine is parallel for, then this is the stack of lambdas to execute
498  # define XKRT_TEAM_PARALLEL_FOR_MAX_FUNC 1
499  alignas(hardware_destructive_interference_size)
500  struct {
501  uint32_t index;
502  std::function<void(team_t * team, thread_t * thread)> f[XKRT_TEAM_PARALLEL_FOR_MAX_FUNC];
503  uint32_t completed;
504  std::atomic<uint32_t> pending;
505  } parallel_for;
506 
507 
508  } priv;
509 
510  };
511 
512  typedef std::function<void(team_t * team, thread_t * thread)> team_parallel_for_func_t;
513  void * team_parallel_for_main(team_t * team, thread_t * thread);
514  # define XKRT_TEAM_ROUTINE_PARALLEL_FOR team_parallel_for_main
